thread.title: Vikings net ninth win, Mustangs, Lions falter in Oct. 15 play
thread.title_full: Vikings net ninth win, Mustangs, Lions falter in Oct. 15 play

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Vikings net ninth win, Mustangs, Lions falter in Oct. 15 play
text:
High school boys and girls soccer Vikings net ninth win, Mustangs, Lions falter in Oct. 15 play By Staff | Oct 16, 2015 
While some Waldo County high school soccer squads continue to eye berths in their respective postseasons, others are simply playing out the string as several teams were in action on the pitch on Thursday, Oct. 15. 
The Searsport boys were the lone winners on the day, while both Belfast teams, along with the Mount View boys, were dealt late-season losses. 
Photos from the Oceanside at Mount View boys game and Medomak Valley at Belfast girls game will appear later with this story. 
The following is a recap of reported results: 
Boys soccer 
Oceanside 4, Mount View 2 
At Thorndike Oct. 15, the Mariners took their first lead of the game in the second half and doubled up the host Mustangs. The squads were tied 1-1 at halftime. 
Leading the Oceanside offense were Christian Straka (2 goals), Titus Kaewthong (goal), Andrew King (goal, 2 assists) and Sam Townsend (assist). 
Brandon Reynolds and Mikey Hustus creased the net in the losing effort for the hosts. 
Both squads attempted 15 shots, while Mount View held a 6-2 edge in corner kicks. 
Seth Davis made 11 saves in goal for the 'Stangs, while Coby Dorr made 13 saves in net for the Mariners. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Mount View (3-10, 16.4796 points) is 16th. Ellsworth (10-1-1, 131.6582 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Medomak Valley 5, Belfast 1 
At Belfast Oct. 15, the Panthers surged past the Lions in the second half en route to their eighth win. Medomak Valley led 1-0 at halftime. 
Zach Starr, Cameron Leach, Alvaro Valls, Jackson Vail and Adam Eutsler creased the net in the win for the Panthers, while Rick Wyman scored for Belfast, off an assist by Sean Kennedy. 
Cameron Robinson made two saves on six shots in goal for Medomak Valley, while Max Lewis made 11 saves on 21 shots in net for Belfast. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Belfast (1-12, 6.7857 points) is 18th (last), while Ellsworth (10-1-1, 131.6582 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Searsport 6, Deer Isle-Stonington 3 
At Deer Isle Oct. 15, the Vikings doubled up the Mariners and prevailed by three scores. 
Leading the Searsport offense were Barrett Grant (2 goals, 2 assists), Liam MacMillan (2 goals), Connor Kneeland (goal, 2 assists), Aaron Wiley (goal) and Troy Reynolds (assist). 
Krisford Melanio netted three goals for Deer Isle-Stonington. 
Ben Powell made three saves on 10 shots in goal for the Vikings, while Ethan Shepard made five saves on 12 shots in net for the Mariners. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class D South, Searsport (9-3-1, 90.5867 points) is third, while Buckfield (12-1, 114.3828 points) is first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Girls soccer 
Belfast 2, Medomak Valley 0 
At Belfast Oct. 15, the Lions avenged an earlier loss to the Panthers and prevailed via shutout. The game was scoreless at halftime. 
Lydia Violette and Ashley Flanders scored in the winning effort for the Lions. 
Chelsea Ripley minded the net for the Panthers and made one save, while Cori Shooter had the shutout in goal for the Lions, as she turned away four shots. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Belfast (2-11, 9.6939 points) is 18th. Oceanside of Rockland/Thomaston (11-0-1, 149.2857 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs.
